The instructor exhibits good knowledge of the subject and is decent teacher, but I found his lack of fluency distracting. For example, I counted 9 'uhs' in just the first 60 seconds of the second video. I noticed this trend continues with expressions such as ‘um’ and ‘ya know’ scattered throughout. I don't mean to be critical, it's just that I'm one of those people who get distracted with disfluencies.
results.content_html: The instructor exhibits good knowledge of the subject and is decent teacher, but I found his lack of fluency distracting. For example, I counted 9 'uhs' in just the first 60 seconds of the second video. I noticed this trend continues with expressions such as ‘um’ and ‘ya know’ scattered throughout. I don't mean to be critical, it's just that I'm one of those people who get distracted with disfluencies.

results.content:
Java is pronounced, 'JAH-VAH'. Also Javascript is pronounced, 'JAH-VAH-script'. The 'a' is not uttered the same way you would in the word, 'apple' or in the name 'Anderson'. Java is Jaaaah-vaaaah. Javascript is Jaaaahvaaaaahscript.

UPDATE:
( ) <- those are called parenthesis, not brackets.
results.content_html:
Java is pronounced, 'JAH-VAH'. Also Javascript is pronounced, 'JAH-VAH-script'. The 'a' is not uttered the same way you would in the word, 'apple' or in the name 'Anderson'. Java is Jaaaah-vaaaah. Javascript is Jaaaahvaaaaahscript.

UPDATE:
( ) <- those are called parenthesis, not brackets.

results.content: Good practical explanation with examples. This is perfect to show what JQuery is about and what the possibilities are for other uses.
results.content_html: Good practical explanation with examples. This is perfect to show what JQuery is about and what the possibilities are for other uses.

results.content:
This is a great course for beginners.  There is a VERY small threshold to quickly go from no experience to getting tangible results in the browser.  

For me, the course is much too rudimentary, but that's only because I already have front-development experience.  No fault of the presenter.  He very clearly stated that this is a beginner course.  It was still worth an hour of my time to check out the course for others.

If you are new to front-end development, take this course!
results.content_html:
This is a great course for beginners. There is a VERY small threshold to quickly go from no experience to getting tangible results in the browser.

For me, the course is much too rudimentary, but that's only because I already have front-development experience. No fault of the presenter. He very clearly stated that this is a beginner course. It was still worth an hour of my time to check out the course for others.

If you are new to front-end development, take this course!

results.content: This is a very easy to follow introduction to jQuery. If you have never written JS or JQ this is a good course to start with to get basic, understanding.
results.content_html: This is a very easy to follow introduction to jQuery. If you have never written JS or JQ this is a good course to start with to get basic, understanding.

results.content: Being new to JQuery was remedied by this course. In small incremental steps John Bura takes you through the syntax of JQuery. He also shows you some features of JQuery to get the hang of it. After completing this course the real studying and work starts. Building some web functionality in JQuery. Enjoy.
results.content_html: Being new to JQuery was remedied by this course. In small incremental steps John Bura takes you through the syntax of JQuery. He also shows you some features of JQuery to get the hang of it. After completing this course the real studying and work starts. Building some web functionality in JQuery. Enjoy.

results.content:
I was watching this to check if it would be good to point a novice to jQuery at. The instructor makes several mistakes while coding and on several occasions passes them off as being 'just how it is', and at one point explains the lag in a queue of animations as being 'down to the recorder', when there are valid explanations for them every time.

While I realise it's a 1 hour course so can't cover everything, the minimum should be that what is covered is accurately explained. Each video is less than one minute long - would it be so hard to re-record the ones where mistakes were made?
results.content_html:
I was watching this to check if it would be good to point a novice to jQuery at. The instructor makes several mistakes while coding and on several occasions passes them off as being 'just how it is', and at one point explains the lag in a queue of animations as being 'down to the recorder', when there are valid explanations for them every time.

While I realise it's a 1 hour course so can't cover everything, the minimum should be that what is covered is accurately explained. Each video is less than one minute long - would it be so hard to re-record the ones where mistakes were made?

results.content: John's delivery is really good, he gets the balance right between being really clear but not overly dumbed down. The pace keeps you paying attention.

results.content: Really great course, swift, succinct and interesting. Started and finished in one morning. This will be a course I revisit time and time again. It makes you want to learn so much more about the topic.

results.content: Another awesome class from John. The one great thing about John's classes is that each one is short enough to watch on the go. So it doesn't matter where you are if you got a few mins to spare you can learn something new. Its nice to have a long class sometimes but short can be sweeter too. A++ class on jQuery.

results.content: Crash course on the least amount of jquery abilities.  I would have preferred a more in-depth course using desktop techonologies.  Does not explain where to store folders/files as everything is done in jsbin.  I'm not a fan online technologies such as jsbin and jupyter notebooks.
results.content_html: Crash course on the least amount of jquery abilities. I would have preferred a more in-depth course using desktop techonologies. Does not explain where to store folders/files as everything is done in jsbin. I'm not a fan online technologies such as jsbin and jupyter notebooks.
